title: History Makers! First Ever Medal For India As Our Seniors Bag Bronze In World Bridge Championships

History Makers! First Ever Medal For India As Our Seniors Bag Bronze In World Bridge Championships

History Makers! First Ever Medal For India As Our Seniors Bag Bronze In World Bridge Championships

India made history when the senior bridge team led by Dipak Poddar won the bronze medal for the first time ever in World Bridge Championships.

Facebook

In the tournament held in China, Indian team were the underdogs having not won a single medal in championships 44 year history. But that wasn't going to be the case, as the senior team scripted history to bag a bronze medal.

It was made official by the Bridge Federation of India.

The senior Indian bridge team comprising captain Dipak Poddar, Jitendra Solani, Subhash Dhakras, Ramamurthy Sridharan, Subrata Saha and Sukamal Das, won the bronze medal, a media release stated which was released on Monday.

Anal Shah (coach) and Vinay Desai (technical analyst) were the other members of the team, it said.

"It was a complete team effort. We came 4th at the World Bridge Championships at Lyon (France) two years ago and are delighted to be able to do better this time. We shall try our best to win the gold medal for our country the next time, Poddar said.

World Bridge Team Championships is a new name for the biennial meet organized by the World Bridge Federation in odd years.

There are three main events, the World Team Championships for national teams in three flights: Open, Women, and Seniors.
